intro: Micromeria juliana, commonly known as the California micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as coastal bluffs and chaparral areas. It has small, narrow leaves and produces capsules as its fruit type. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
